name: market for port facilities | port facilities | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6937/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'port facilities', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of construction, maintenance,  land use and the decommission of one port. The service is based on the conditions at the Port of Rotterdam, in the Netherlands. It includes  the construction material, energy use and disposal for excavation, transport of the deconstructed material, disposal of the materials, emissions and energy consumption. 

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
